intro: Polyscias mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf sycamore, is a flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are typically covered in a fine, velvety texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berries that are often red or orange in color. Polyscias mollis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
